name: Has the builder provided a marked up plan on each area to be waterproofed?
Marked up plan has to be numbered if more than one area at a time is to be completed
Has the concrete been cured for 28 days, date of pour to be provided?
Has concrete moisture test been carried out and the result was provided for the locations on a marked up plan?
The moisture level should be around 7%
Is the concrete finished to an acceptable steel trowel class finish?
Have all tape, steel wire, nails, plywood or formwork, bracing, dyna bolt and/or steel brackets been removed and patched?
Is there any cracking in the substrate? If yes, an engineer’s report will need to be provided or the builder must sign off prior to commencement of works
Has any chemicals been used in the concrete process that may affect the membrane adhesion?
Puddle flanges used or installed must be recessed flush to the top of the concrete surface
Builder to check correct falls to drains
Patching to be completed 3 days prior to waterproofing proposed start date and/or second inspection required
Adequate spacing to seal around each one for Cast in items (conduit, water pipes etc).  No flexible conduits permitted
Would recommend using Enviro mortar 45 for all pin holes, overfilled then stoned back when dry
Specification / Standard: AS4654.1-2012; AS3740 - 2010, Manufacturer’s Technical Data Sheet

Check substrate. The surface must be clean, dry and free from all loose particles including dust, laitance, grease, coatings, curing compounds and any other foreign matter. Check critical areas (puddle flanges, penetrations, expansion joints, rebates/setdowns)

Substrate Preparation and Caulking. Prepare surface to accept primer using a scraper or grinder and vacuum or sweep residual debris. Remove all sharp edges including screws, nails and concrete/mortar projections. Apply a suitable and approved joint sealant such as Enviro Flex Pro or Enviro Flex FC to all joints and connecting building parts prior to  the  application  of  Enviro 700X
Priming. Apply primer (Enviro Epoxy B-LV / Enviro Prime P2 / Enviro Shield) using a brush or roller. Allow  primer  to  fully  cure  before  proceeding  with  the application of Enviro 700X

Mixing and Application. HP1200 should be thoroughly mixed with a mechanical mixer at low speed (less than 400 RPM) prior to application. Apply Enviro 700X using brush/roller achieving 1.6mm WFT / 1.5mm DFT. (2 coats)
Curing. Allow product to cure for 12 hours before recoating. Care should be taken when walking over newly installed Enviro 700X to ensure the membrane is not damaged

Top Coat. Enviro 700X should be thoroughly mixed using a mechanical mixer at low speed prior to application.Add Part B to Part A and mix to a uniform colour and consistency for a minimum of 3 minutes. Allow to react for 10 minutes before application. Allow to react for 15 minutes when thinning with Enviro Thinner No.8 before application. Do not apply in damp or wet conditions. Allow each coat to sufficiently dry before proceeding to the next coat
Testing. Carry out Spark Testing and adhesion tests. Repair pinholes and imperfections. Areas marked indicate location of Test
Final signoff and handover. Visually inspect and ensure adequately cured. Check for any pinholes and bubbles. Sign-off from builder and hand-over
HOLD POINT - CLICK HERE TO REQUEST BUILDER SIGN OFF

Specification / Standard: AS4654.1-2012; AS3740 - 2010, Manufacturer’s Technical Data Sheet
Check substrate. Blinding sound and level, Trowel finished, no voids or leftover formwork or sharp edges. NCR any unacceptable items
Free substrate of Dirt and Debris where required.
Reinspect substrate. Polyseal applicator - Area clean and dry, ready to instal sheet membrane
Lay BSM - Overlap as per manufacturers instructions, stragger cut joins where possible, detail strip to be installed at cut joins.
Apply Hp 1600 to Dwall BEFORE bars ensure lap down onto BSM
Following bar install, bar to be detailed with flex fc, 700x to be applied with a 50mm return on the bar, bars to be epoxied in by others (generous amount of epoxy required)
epoxy incapulation to pipe penos, Pile cap to be incapsulated with epoxy grout 50mm finished height
InspecInspection of Membrane - Pre Reo (Polyseal & Client & Enviro systems )tion of Membrane, All Elements to be reinspected. Corner terminations, overlaps, pile heads
Final signoff and handover. Visually inspect and ensure adequately cured. Check for any pinholes and bubbles. Sign-off from builder and hand-over
HOLD POINT - CLICK HERE TO REQUEST BUILDER SIGN OFF
Check substrate - The surface must be clean, dry and free from all loose particles
Prepare surface to accept primer using scraper (and/or light grind) and vacuum/sweep residual debris. Remove all concrete/mortar projections
Caulking - Apply Enviro Flex FC / PRO to the junction between floor slab and walls
Apply primer using a brush or roller
Apply Enviro HP1600 using a spray gun

Pin Hole Detection Test of area with holiday tester
Pull Off Adhesion Testing shall not be less than 1MPa. Thickness shall not be less than 1.5mm
Final Inspection and Sign-off. Visually inspect and ensure adequately cured - DO NOT PASS UNTIL HOLDPOINT COMPLETE BELOW

Specification / Standard: AS4654.1-2012; AS3740 - 2010, Manufacturer’s Technical Data Sheet
Check Substrate Check for cracks/defect in concrete. Check critical areas (puddle flanges, penetrations, expansion joints, rebates/setdowns).
Prepare Substrate. (moisture test if required) prepare surface  to accept primer using a scraper or grinder and vacuum or sweep residual debris.
Apply Sarnacol. Record atmospheric & substrate conditions & notate in QA Documents. Humidity <85%, Delta >3⁰, Air Temp 5-40⁰.
Apply Sarnafil. Overlap as per manufacturers instructions,75mm, stagger cut joins where possible, detail strip to be installed at cut joins.
Weld all joins, Ensure PPE, Respirator, fire extuinguisher within vicinity. Weld overlap in one direction to avoid ribbons --Ensure 75mm overlap

Install Pressure Bar, Install as instructed by builder to finish termination height. Install sealant is placed above pressure bar. Every second hole on pressure bar to be drilled. 1 hole overlap on edge of termination bar
Check all welds with spatula/screwdriver for lifts. Use blunt pointed object to ensure all welds correctly sealed. Any lifts, circle to return to weld
First signoff. Visually inspect and ensure adequately cured. Check for any potential defects. Sign-off from builder.
Inspection of welds. All Elements to be inspected. Corner terminations, overlaps, lifts, burns, joins, and pressure seal
Test Welds. All Elements to be reinspected. Corner terminations, overlaps, pile heads. ensure all action items from previous inspection have been resolved.
Final signoff. Visually inspect and ensure adequately cured. Sign-off from builder and hand-over
HOLD POINT - CLICK HERE TO REQUEST BUILDER SIGN OFF
Specification / Standard: AS4654.1-2012; AS3740 - 2010, Manufacturer’s Technical Data Sheet
Check Substrate Check for cracks/defect in concrete. Check critical areas (puddle flanges, penetrations, expansion joints, rebates/setdowns).
Prepare Substrate. (moisture test if required) prepare surface  to accept primer using a scraper or grinder and vacuum or sweep residual debris.
Measure and Temporarily fix ElastoFlex or Combiflex
Install ElastoFlex or Combiflex to Movement Joint locations
Remove Push Pins and Patch holes
Final signoff. Visually inspect and ensure adequately cured. Sign-off from builder and hand-over

Check substrate - The surface must be clean, dry and free from all loose particles
Prepare surface to accept primer using scraper (and/or light grind) and vacuum/sweep residual debris. Remove all concrete/mortar projections
Caulking - Apply Enviro Flex FC / PRO to the junction between floor slab and walls
Apply primer using a brush or roller
Apply Enviro HP1200 using a spray gun

Pin Hole Detection Test of area with holiday tester
Pull Off Adhesion Testing shall not be less than 1MPa. Thickness shall not be less than 1.5mm

Wear Coat - Mix and Apply Enviro 900 with brush or new roller (spray application optional)
Broadcast aggregate uniformly to the wet Enviro 900 within the timeframes specified

Top Coat
Mix and Apply Enviro 850 with brush or new roller (second coat optional pending specification)
Final Inspection and Sign-off. Visually inspect and ensure adequately cured - DO NOT PASS UNTIL HOLDPOINT COMPLETE BELOW

Specification / Standard: AS4654.1-2012; AS3740 - 2010, Manufacturer’s Technical Data Sheet
Check Substrate/Work Area, Check for cracks/defect in concrete. Check critical areas (puddle flanges, penetrations, expansion joints, rebates/setdowns).
Prepare Substrate. (moisture test if required) Prepare surface to accept primer using a scraper or grinder and vacuum or sweep residual debris.
Apply primer (Enviro Shield/Enviro prime P2 or Enviro Epoxy B-LV) by brush/roller
Caulking. Apply Enviro Flex FC junction fillets (where applicable)
Mixing and Application. Mix Enviro 700X thoroughtly using mechanical mixer. Apply Enviro 700X using brush/roller achieving 1.6mm WFT / 1.5mm DFT.
Carry out Dry Film Thickness test & Holiday Testing & Pull Off Test, Repair any defects found using patch and repair method specified in procedures.
Final Inspection and Sign-off. Visually inspect and ensure adequately cured - DO NOT PASS UNTIL HOLDPOINT COMPLETE BELOW

Specification / Standard: AS3740 - 2010, Manufacturer’s Technical Data Sheet

Mixing - using horizontal forced action mixers or screed pumps, mix 20kg Enviro Rapid Screed with 100kg Gravel Mix 0 – 4mm; gradually add 9.5 – 11L of clean water (mixing water may vary depending on the moisture content of the Gravel Mix). Mixing time is 2 minutes.
Prepare surface to accept primer using scraper (and/or light grind) and vacuum/sweep residual debris. Remove all concrete/mortar projections.
Check Substrate - The surface must be clean, dry and free from all loose particles
Apply Screeding to Substrate in accordance with documentations and desired falls.
Final Inspection and Sign-off. Visually inspect and ensure adequately cured - DO NOT PASS UNTIL HOLDPOINT COMPLETE BELOW

Specification / Standard: AS4654.1-2012; AS3740 - 2010, Manufacturer’s Technical Data Sheet

Check substrate. The surface must be clean, dry and free from all loose particles including dust, laitance, grease, coatings, curing compounds and any other foreign matter. Check critical areas (puddle flanges, penetrations, expansion joints, rebates/setdowns)

Substrate Preparation and Caulking. Prepare surface to accept primer using a scraper or grinder and vacuum or sweep residual debris. Remove all sharp edges including screws, nails and concrete/mortar projections. Apply a suitable and approved joint sealant such as Enviro Flex Pro or Enviro Flex FC to all joints and connecting building parts prior to  the  application  of  Enviro 700X.
Priming. Apply primer (Enviro Epoxy B-LV / Enviro Prime P2 / Enviro Shield) using a brush or roller. Allow  primer  to  fully  cure  before  proceeding  with  the application of Enviro 700X.

Mixing and Application. Enviro 700X should be thoroughly mixed with a mechanical mixer at low speed (less than 400 RPM) prior to application. Apply Enviro 700X using brush/roller achieving 1.6mm WFT / 1.5mm DFT. (2 coats).
Curing. Allow product to cure for 12 hours before recoating. Care should be taken when walking over newly installed Enviro 700X to ensure the membrane is not damaged.
Top Coat. Enviro 250NS should be thoroughly mixed using a mechanical mixer at low speed prior to application. Do not mix in air.

APPLICATION: In exposed areas, do not apply if rain is expected within 6hours. Enviro 250 NS can be applied using a roller (6mmnap recommended). Apply 2 coats of Enviro 250 NS (each coat at a wet film thickness of 0.6mm), to achieve a 0.6mm Dry Film Thickness (DFT).

Do not apply as one heavy coat. Preferably, apply at 90° to the direction of the previous coat. Ensure that all areas receive a sufficient coating thickness and are free of all defects such as pinholes. Allow each coat to sufficiently dry before proceeding to the next coat. Thicker coats will take longer to dry.
Testing. Carry out Spark Testing and adhesion tests. Repair pinholes and imperfections. Areas marked indicate location of Test.
Final signoff and handover. Visually inspect and ensure adequately cured. Check for any pinholes and bubbles. Sign-off from builder and hand-over
